criterion: Reward for accurately documenting all patient-reported symptoms and subjective descriptions from the transcript, including the character of the nausea (different, less intense, still uncomfortable) and the slight improvement in anxiety.

Reward for faithfully capturing the clinician's counseling and plan as spoken: expectation that side-effects may settle in weeks, ongoing monitoring, possible dose or timing adjustment if nausea persists, and confirmation of taking medication with food.
Reward for correctly including medication and administration details supported by transcript or chart (e.g., Sertraline 50 mg daily from the chart and that it is taken with breakfast).
Reward for documenting the existing diagnosis of generalized anxiety disorder from the chart when relevant to the visit.
Penalize for omitting any key element explicitly stated or clearly implied in the transcript (e.g., description of nausea difference, monitoring plan, taking with food).
Penalize for introducing information not present in either transcript or relevant chart sections (e.g., new vitals, lab orders, additional medications, physical exam findings).
Penalize for inaccuracies or distortions of facts from transcript or chart (wrong medication name/dose, misstated symptom severity, incorrect timelines, etc.).
Penalize for indiscriminate or irrelevant copying from the chart that was not referenced or implied during the encounter (e.g., unrelated family history, unused templated sections).
